I've just gotten into parameterized testing and customized JUnit4
Runners, =
but I have a few questions:

How do I go about making a parameterized test =
for which a single
default parameter value is provided if a list of paramet=
er values is
not given?  (It appears to me that you may need to have a cust=
om
runner that's similar to Parameterized)

Furthermore, suppose I have a s=
ubclass of this test, which defines a
second parameter, which, unlike the f=
irst, is a required parameter
(ie. I can choose to have my list of paramete=
rs as either two values
or a single, which would assume the usage of a defa=
ult value).  How
would I go about doing that?  (Would I need to use a diffe=
rent runner?)

How would I generalize this to any number of parameters (req=
uired and
optional)?

Finally, what if I wanted my parameterized tests to b=
e named via some
naming function (instead of serially numbered like Paramet=
erized)?
